posts._title: Fernando Di Leo – Il poliziotto è marcio AKA Shoot First, Die Later (1974)
posts.title: Il poliziotto è marcio
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Luc Merenda gives the performance of his career as a highly regarded police detective who is taking syndicate money in exchange for departmental favors. His father, a simple man, also works for the department but on a lower rung; he isn’t jealous of his son, but rather proud of him, little knowing that he’s a …

posts._title: Fernando Di Leo – Il boss AKA Wipeout! AKA The Boss (1973)
posts.title: Il boss
posts.excerpt: A bomb attack in a cinema in Palermo kills all the fellows of Attardi’s clan a part from Cocchi. He immediately understands that the author of the bomb attack is Daniello from Don Corrasco’s clan. Cocchi is determined to revenge. His actions, including the Corrasco’s daughter kidnap, in a Palermo in which also the police …

posts._title: Wei Lo – Du long tan AKA Dragon Swamp (1969)
posts.title: Du long tan
posts.excerpt: In another one of Lo Wei’s excellent wuxia films, the powerful Jade Dragon Sword is stolen by the devious Tang Dachuan (Wong Chung-Shun). His plan involved the seduction of the owner’s daughter, Fan Ying (Cheng Pei-Pei), and when she is found and the sword recovered, she is banished to the Dragon Swamp for 20 years. …

posts._title: Pierre Perrault – C’était un Québecois en Bretagne, Madame (1977)
posts.title: C’était un Québecois en Bretagne, Madame
posts.excerpt: Hauris Lalancette, from Abitibi, travel and draws parallels between two amazing parts of the country that are considered poor and neglected. It is also about the search for ancestors and nostalgia of the old crafts that were better, both on the human side and technical side.

posts._title: Pierre Perrault – Le pays de la terre sans arbre ou Le mouchouânipi AKA The Land without Trees (1980)
posts.title: Le pays de la terre sans arbre ou Le mouchouânipi
posts.excerpt: It is a documentary joining 3 periods of filming in the Mouchouanipi, which is a faraway land in the North of eastern Canada. Anthropologists, archeologists and native people all together in this «land without trees». They are hunting the caribous, using the old ways of the native people. This expedition leads to sharing experiences, points …

posts.title: Lucia
posts.excerpt: Lucia is a young woman who works as a seamstress in a factory and lives with her father in an old house in Santiago, Chile. The film occurs in December 2006 during the weeks that take place from the ex-dictator Pinochet’s funeral to Christmas. Through the simple observation of Lucia’s daily life, the spectator is …

posts.title: Lions Love
posts.excerpt: Quote:Agnes Varda directed this drama which combines formal dramatic structures with the openness of improvisational cinema verite. Independent filmmaker Shirley Clarke plays an avant-garde film director attempting to work with a major studio to finance her next project, in which she hopes to collaborate with James Rado and Jerome Ragni, creators of the musical Hair …

posts._title: Philip S. Solomon – Psalm IV: ‘Valley of the Shadow’ (2013)
posts.title: Psalm IV: ‘Valley of the Shadow’
posts.excerpt: SynopsisPairs moody landscape imagery culled from a video game with John Huston’s reading of James Joyce’s ‘The Dead’.

posts._title: Sang-soo Hong – Gangbyeon hotel AKA Hotel by the River (2018)
posts.title: Gangbyeon hotel
posts.excerpt: SynopsisIt is the dead of winter and a poet invites his sons to join him at a hotel for a reunion. The hotel also hosts a newly single woman who has a friend keep her company and with whom she shares a room, strolls and conversations. The poet is drawn to the beautiful girls and …
